c74object.name: the.jit.pinealis
c74object.digest: Perform a simple framecheck on offline rendered video files.
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2020, www.xenorama.com.
Linked with the.jit.thalamus, allows for performing a simple framecheck and scrubbing through a previously rendered videofile. Any video can be loaded into the.jit.pinealis.

objarg.name: render-context
objarg.digest: Specify a named render context to bind to.
objarg.description: For convenience, this can be identical to one's world render context name but is to be considered independent. the.jit.thalamus with a unique context name is required running in parallel for all members of the offline render family to sync and respond to.

attribute.name: autopopulate
attribute.digest: Send the first frame out the leftmost outlet
attribute.description:
Send the first frame out the leftmost outlet upon reading a moviefile manually, or automatically after a successful render process
The default is 1 (enabled)

attribute.name: boundmode
attribute.description:
When scrubbing through framewise, this sets the handler for frames exceeding the moviefile's length.
There are four different modes available:
fold : mirror playback at beginning and end
wrap : restart at the beginning when reaching the end
clip : first first or last frame, respectively (default)
none : remain at latest valid frame
palindrome : same as fold
mirror : same as fold
clamp : same as clip
ignore : same as none

attribute.name: container
attribute.digest: Specify the type of video footage
attribute.description:
Videos can be available either as moviefile or image sequence. The word container, followed by a symbol specifying a filetype, will attempt to load the corresponding file provided by the most previously completed render process, or by the read message.
There are three different modes available:
auto : adapt to the current filetype in the.jit.thalamus (default)
mov : load a moviefile
img_sequence : load the first of an available image sequence, the int message will increment through the images as frames (leftmost outlet)

method.name: int
method.description: Output the frame at the numeric position. Frames outside of the movie's length will be handled according to the mode attribute.

method.name: read
method.description: Manually read a videofile. The first frame is immediately output when autopopulate is enabled (default = 1).
